c:
I send messages, one after another,
Never annoyed, never tired.
More than fifty, I've lost count,
But they don't look, or maybe they do,
And just ignore me.

Maybe they don't like me anymore.
They come online, my heart jumps-
"Maybe now, they'll see my message,"
"Maybe now, they'll say something!"
I keep hoping, but they stay busy,
Leaving me unseen.

I wait unread in their inbox.
I send more, refresh the screen.
They're online, but no reply comes.
So many messages, all for them.
Finally, it says, "Seen!"

My heartbeat races.
Will they scold me now?
I've sent too many messages,
But it's my fault,
I'm the one who nags.

They send a few words,
Or say they're busy.
I believe them,
I have to believe.
I can't let them go,
But I can't hold on either.

People say, "They don't love you anymore!"
But I don't listen.
I'd rather trust them,
Be shameless for them.
They send two messages for every hundred I send,
And I find comfort in that.

They must be so busy!
Is it wrong to love them too much?
Is it wrong to trust them blindly?
They've been online for an hour now,
I keep sending,
But they haven't seen them yet.

Maybe they're busy,
Busy ignoring me,
Or busy in someone else's inbox.



#love #unseen #message #hope #wait #trust #heartbreak #loneliness
